programme.title: Donnie Darko: The Director's Cut
programme.desc: An unusual teenager (Jake Gyllenhaal) follows the instructions of the 6-foot-tall rabbit which saved his life.

programme.title: Knowing
programme.desc: A professor (Nicolas Cage) and his son obtain an encoded time-capsule document that lists every major disaster over the past 50 years and predicts a future global calamity.

programme.title: Drive Angry 3D
programme.desc: A vengeful father escapes from hell and chases after the men who killed his daughter and kidnapped his granddaughter.

programme.title: Bangkok Dangerous
programme.desc: A hitman who's in Bangkok to pull off a series of jobs violates his personal code when he falls for a local woman and bonds with his errand boy.

programme.title: Firewalker
programme.desc: Two guys (Chuck Norris, Louis Gossett Jr.) and a girl (Melody Anderson) brave jungle hazards to find an Aztec temple filled with gold.

programme.title: Knock Off
programme.desc: Hong Kong business partners (Jean-Claude Van Damme, Rob Schneider) tangle with villains smuggling miniature explosive devices.

programme.title: 200 mph
programme.desc: After his older brother's death, a young amateur racer plunges into the world of illegal street-racing to get revenge.

programme.title: El Rey's Top 5
programme.desc: Host Vanessa Gritton and her guests Danielle Radford and Zena Dixon list their top five zombie apocalypse gear.

programme.sub-title: Top 5 As Seen on TV Products
programme.desc: Vanessa is joined by Danielle Perez and Ed Greer.

programme.title: Precious Cargo
programme.desc: To get back in the good graces of her murderous boss (Bruce Willis), a seductive thief (Claire Forlani) recruits an ex-lover (Mark-Paul Gosselaar) to steal rare and valuable gems.
